name: within
posTip: Word used before noun, pronoun or -ing form of verb to show place, direction, etc.

trans_examp.trans_en: inside or not further than an area or period of time

example.eg: Two thirds of Californians live within 15 miles of the coast.
example.egtrans: 三分之二的加利福尼亚人居住在离海岸15英里以内的地区。

example.eg: In 1992 cross-border controls within the EU were dismantled.
example.egtrans: 1992年，欧盟内部取消了边境通行管制。

example.eg: For orders within the UK, please enclose £2.50 for post and packing.
example.egtrans: 英国国内的订货，请附上2.5英镑的邮资及包装费用。

example.eg: The resort lies within easy reach of (= not far from) the ski slopes.
example.egtrans: 该景点距离滑雪坡道不远。

example.eg: We recommend that this wine should be consumed within six months.
example.egtrans: 我们建议该酒在6个月内饮用完毕。

example.eg: Within hours of the tragedy happening, an emergency rescue team had been assembled.
example.egtrans: 悲剧发生后几小时之内，就集结起来一支紧急救援队伍。

example.eg: The tickets should reach you within the week (= before the end of this week).
example.egtrans: 票将在本周内送到你处。

example.eg: He's very highly regarded within his profession.
example.egtrans: 他在业内得到很高的评价。

example.eg: She managed to complete her last film well within budget.
example.egtrans: 她设法在预算内拍完了她最新一部电影。

example.eg: The target was now within range and so she took aim and fired.
example.egtrans: 当时目标正处于射程范围内，于是她瞄准并开火。

example.eg: He could sense that his goal was within reach (= it could be reached).
example.egtrans: 他可以感觉到自己的目标能够实现。

example.eg: The cathedral spire was now within sight (= it could be seen).
example.egtrans: 已经可以看到教堂的尖顶了。

example.eg: I was acting within the law (= legally).
example.egtrans: 我在法律允许范围内行事。

example.eg: We came within five points of beating them (= we would have beaten them if we had had five more points).
example.egtrans: 我们要是再多拿5分就可以击败他们了。
